data.title: Choose the correct answer for each question

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'bare' and 'bear' in everyday usage.

words.word: He walked with bare feet.
He walked with bear feet.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'bear' and 'bare' in everyday usage.

words.word: I saw a bear in the forest.
I saw a bare in the forest.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'flour' and 'flower' in everyday usage.

words.word: We need more flour to bake bread.
We need more flower to bake bread.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'flower' and 'flour' in everyday usage.

words.word: This flower smells nice.
This flour smells nice.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'sea' and 'see' in everyday usage.

words.word: We swam in the sea.
We swam in the see.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'see' and 'sea' in everyday usage.

words.word: I see the bird.
I sea the bird.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'son' and 'sun' in everyday usage.

words.word: My son is five years old.
My sun is five years old.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'sun' and 'son' in everyday usage.

words.word: The sun is bright today.
The son is bright today.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'toe' and 'tow' in everyday usage.

words.word: I hurt my toe playing football.
I hurt my tow playing football.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'tow' and 'toe' in everyday usage.

words.word: They had to tow the car.
They had to toe the car.
